course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Engineering Geology
course.description: This course introduces fundamental knowledge in engineering geology and related engineering topics, including the earth system and tectonics, rock-forming minerals and clay minerals, igneous / sedimentary / metamorphic rocks, structural geology, earthquakes, surface processes and soil formation. It also includes field trips to Hong Kong GeoParks.

reviews.author: mhcm138
reviews.title: Best Choice for CIVL Elective
reviews.comment_content:
ğŸ“—âœ’ï¸Interesting and not difficult to understand

1ï¸âƒ£ The Earth System and Plate Tectonics
2ï¸âƒ£ Rock Forming Minerals
3ï¸âƒ£ Igneous Rocks
4ï¸âƒ£ Sedimentary Rock
5ï¸âƒ£ Metamorphism
6ï¸âƒ£ Structural Geology***
7ï¸âƒ£ Hong Kong Geology, Rocks and Soils
8ï¸âƒ£ Clay minerals, soil structure and classification (very similar to 3730)
9ï¸âƒ£ Geo-hazards: Earthquakes, Landslides and landslip prevention in HK  
ğŸ”¸Supplementary Note: Consolidation and settlement in clay

Generally speaking, this course is a combination of geography and geology with some emphasizes on engineering applications (dam, excavation, foundation, bridge, slope) and properties of different types of rocks. Moreover, there are rock identification sessions in the lectures. Make sure to pay extra attention because this will be examined in the mid-term and final

***This chapter involves trigonometry and geometry calculations for a map. It might be quite confusing to visualize a geological map in a 3D perspective. It is recommended to put more efforts on this chapter.
reviews.comment_teaching:
âœ… Prof. WANG delivered the lectures with clear English. His lecture notes were so detailed and colorful. For the Structural Geology part, which i thought the most challenging part, he demonstrated how to do the map problems with visualizer clearly

âœ… Not compulsory to attend the lectures. Lecture videos will be released in a non-regularly basis.
reviews.comment_grading:
ğŸ¤© Very generous grade distribution according to the statistics given by professor in the first lesson. 50% for A and B range respectively.

Midterm was cancelled due to social event.

1ï¸âƒ£ Lab&Field Trip Report: 40%
2ï¸âƒ£ Final Exam: 60%

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ“ My performance for your reference:
LAB 1: 9/10
LAB 2: 9.5/10
Field Trip 1: 9.75/10
Field Trip 2: 10/10
Final Exam: ???/100

Final Grade: A+ (Professor mentioned 6 A+ were given)
reviews.comment_workload: No tutorials! Very light workload compared to other CIVL courses. Only need to submit group reports for 2 labs and 2 field trips.

reviews.author: edenhazard
reviews.title: Recommend for year 3
reviews.comment_content:
Geology is a compulsory course for HKU and PolyU but not UST. If you want to be a geotechnical engineer, you better take it.

Topics:
Â·  The earth system and plate tectonics
Â·    Rock-forming minerals
Â·    Igneous rocks and volcanic rocks
Â·    Sedimentary rocks
Â·    Metamorphic rocks
Â·    Structural geology
Â·    Surface process, clay minerals and soil formation
Â·    Overview of Hong Kong geology
Â·    Geohazards: earthquakes and landslides
Â·    Case studies of engineering geology in construction
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Wang is a nice and passionate teacher. He explained the concepts clearly and slowly to make sure everyone can follow. He loves to carry a big box to bring his rock samples to class and shows them to us. He even extended the deadline for the last hw becoz someone sent him an email to request.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework & Report 30%
Midterm  30%
Final  40%
About 50% of the class get A range. Very good.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. Only 4 easy hw. Fun to watch the virtual field trip on youtube. The only difficult part is structural geology which needs time to digest.

reviews.author: chwong
reviews.title: Good grade, Low workload
reviews.comment_content:
This course is about engineering geology which is related to the structure and attributes of the rocks connected with engineering works.

- study of concept and knowledge in engineering geology and rock mechanics, such as minerals and rocks, structural geology, earthquakes, surface processes
reviews.comment_teaching:
Detailed notes with a lot of photos explaining every important point

- 1.5 hr per lesson and twice a week
- two field trip on late September and late October ( compulsory )
- two lab from week 3 to 7 about rock identification (in the lab you just need to watch a video then you can go)
reviews.comment_grading:
Labs report 10%

Field trips report 20%

Midterm 30% - open notes, rock identifications with real sample, 20 MC, 3 long questions but each sub questions worth 2 point only no matter it is difficult or not

Final 40% - open notes, no rock identification,  similar to mid term but with calculation on soil settlement

Past statistics: more than 50% of the student could get A range in this course

FYI: >90/100 in midterm, no final no score, get A+
reviews.comment_workload:
2 Lab reports
2 Field trip reports
No assignments
Readings - Remember the position of the important things in the note, it will be easily for you find the answer during exam

reviews.author: RIPCA
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content:
1. The earth system and plate tectonics
2. Rock forming minerals
3. Igneous rocks
4. Sedimentary rocks
5. Metamorphic rocks
6. Structural Geology
7. Clay minerals and soil formation
8. Overview of Hong Kong geology

Quite interesting course.
This course include both geology and geography information, Introducing properties, usage of different rocks. Although it is quite hard to figure out the 3D perspective from the geological map, other parts were not difficult at all.
The mid-term exam include a part to identify different rocks showing by professor according to their texture, hardness told by professor, color and parts by observation
reviews.comment_teaching: Pro. WANG is a good professor from mainland, his ascent is not excellent but quite easy to follow. The notes were detailed and colored, he demonstrated the map problems step-by-step and it is easy to follow. Pro. WANG always stay in the zoom session after the lecture for 5-30 minutes to explain about the notes for detail and answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Labs 10%
Field trips 20%
Midterm 30%
Final 40%

As labs and field trips were cancelled, the percentage transferred into assignments and final exam percentage were increased.

The professors presented a graph at the beginning of lecture that 50% of student in this course would get grade above A-.

My grade for reference:
HW1: 9.45/10
HW2: 8/10
HW3: 10/10
HW4: 9.5/10
HW5: 8.65/10
Midterm: 82/100
Final: 77/100

Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
As the lecture were through online-lesson mode this year, the lab and field trip were transferred into 5 assignments and final exam.
There is no tutorial for this course.
The assignments were not that difficult and good practice.
The final exam were open book and many of the answer can be found in lecture notes.

reviews.author: JohnKwan627
reviews.comment_content: Quite good. The lectures cover a lot of basic content about geology. The course does not require much knowledge in other geology courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very clear and have lecture video. The lecture notes is good also.
reviews.comment_grading: More than reasonable. The mean grade is about B+ to A-. The difficulty of the exam is reasonable and it is open-book. The mid-term exam includes a section requires student to distinguish different kinds of rocks.
reviews.comment_workload: no assignment, only 2 lab reports and 2 field reports. But the field trips are scheduled on Saturday.
